item.title: Wreckreation Developer Facing Company-Wide Redundancies
item.content:encoded:
Three Fields Entertainment is a studio in dire straits. The developers of the recently released Wreckreation have revealed that the entire company has been put on redundancy notice.

In a post on LinkedIn on Thursday morning, CEO Fiona Sperry wrote a length message about the situation.

Wreckreation launched in October, and was published by THQ Nordic, a subsidiary of Embracer. However, based on her messaging, there hasn’t been much in the way of support from the publisher.

In her statement, Sperry says that Three Fields Entertainment “will not see revenue from game sales for the foreseeable future.” The studio, she said, has had to self-fund for most of 2025 and through all of the post-launch content.

“Without the enthusiasm or financial support from our publisher to continue development, we simply cannot sustain the studio in its current form,” Sperry said. “Making this decision has been unbelievably painful.

“This is a heartbreaking moment for all of us. What makes it even harder is that we have so many things in the pipeline — multiple features, updates, and creative ideas that we were excited to bring to the game, many of which are showcased in the video we’re sharing today. These are things we genuinely believed would have continued to strengthen Wreckreation and grow its community.”

Sperry writes that her hope is that by showing the latest internal work publicly for the first time, it will lead to funding or interest from a different company.

“But even if that hope does not materialise, we want this to stand as a testament to our vision and to the strength, passion, and skill of our tiny team,” she said. “I truly believe in the potential of this game and in the brilliance of the people who built it.”

How do you feel about the entire team at Three Fields Entertainment being put on redundancy notice? Leave your thoughts down below and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more Insider Gaming, read about the game Eidos-Montreal had been working on before the Embracer buyout. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Was the Most Downloaded PS5 Game in November 2025
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has been revealed as the most downloaded PS5 game in the month of November 2025.

Black Ops 7, the latest Call of Duty title released on November 14, 2025, wasn’t able to make the same impact as previous instalments in the franchise. The game suffered the worst launch in Japan in its 20-year history, sales were down by 50% in Europe, and it hit a series low Metacritic user rating. However, things don’t seem too bad, as it dominated the PS5 store last month.

Black Ops 7 Dominates PS5 Charts in November 2025

Sony PlayStation is back again with its monthly charts, revealing the top downloads across PS5, PS4, PS VR2, and free-to-play games in the month of November 2025, and we already know where Black Ops 7 shone. In PS4, Red Dead Redemption 2 was the top dog, PSVR 2 had Alien: Rogue Incursion VR in the lead, and the free-to-play section was split between Where Winds Meet and Battlefield REDSEC. Check out the top 5 most downloaded games across all categories below:

PS5

US/Canada

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  • ARC Raiders
  • Dispatch
  • Battlefield 6
  • NBA 2K26

EU

  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  • EA Sports FC 26
  • ARC Raiders
  • Battlefield 6
  • Dispatch

PS4

US/Canada

  • Red Dead Redemption 2
  • Batman: Arkham Knight
  • Call of Duty: Black Ops 7
  • A Way Out
  • Grand Theft Auto 5

EU

  • Red Dead Redemption 2
  • EA Sports FC 26
  • A Way Out
  • Unravel Two
  • The Forest

PSVR2

US/Canada

  • Alien: Rogue Incursion VR
  • Beat Saber
  • Arizona Sunshine Remake
  • Metro Awakening
  • Job Simulator

EU

  • Alien: Rogue Incursion VR
  • Metro Awakening
  • Horizon Call of the Mountain
  • Beat Saber
  • Arizona Sunshine Remake

Free to Play (PS5 + PS4)

US/Canada

  • Where Winds Meet
  • Battlefield REDSEC
  • Fortnite
  • Roblox
  • Call of Duty: Warzone

EU

  • Battlefield REDSEC
  • Where Winds Meet
  • Fortnite
  • Roblox
  • Call of Duty: Warzone

In other news, Treyarch is pushing SBMM in Black Ops 7 due to “increased engagement”. Additionally, here are the Season 1 patch notes for the new title. What are your thoughts on Black Ops 7 being the most downloaded PS5 game in November 2025? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, check out GTA Online players getting free $500,000 through Discord. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.
